intro: Sonerila macrophylla, commonly known as the large-leaf sonerila, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its large, glossy leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows as an understory shrub in humid, shaded environments. The fruit is a capsule that contains numerous small, elliptical seeds.
